item.title: Loops using R
item.description: Introduction Introduction this post has the intentionality to present briefly one of the property that exist in a ordinary square regression. if(!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman") ## Loading required package: pacman p_load("tidyverse","gridExtra") set.seed(123) reps <- 10000 betas <- matrix(NA, nrow = reps, ncol = 2) beta0 <- 2 beta1 <- 2.5 beta2 <- 1 su = 2 n = c(100,1000) #tama√±o muestral for (j in 1:length(n)) { X1=rnorm(n[j],20,1) X2=runif(n[j],0,1) for (i in 1:reps) { u <- rnorm(n[j],0,su) Y <- beta0 + beta1*X1 + beta2*X2 + u model = lm(Y~X1) #Estima OLS - omite variable X2 betas[i,j] = model$coef[2] } } mean(betas[,1]) ## [1] 2.
